answers.answer: I would but honestly if your not comfortable then find a doctor that will be more attentive to your baby
Thanks because i just feel that anything can go wrong and i wouldn't even know
Most doctors do the 20week ultra sound and they don't do another unless they think something is wrong or when u are almost due.

My last ultrasound was at 31 weeks.I won't know the weight of my baby until she's born.Like emommy said... Most don't get anymore after the 20 week mark. That's just how it is. They measure your stomach which can give them an idea of how big your baby will be. They can also press on your stomach and feel where your baby is, so they'll be able to tell you if they're head down. Another ultrasound really isn't necessary.

Well if you are not comfortable with the doctor then change but keep in mind this far along you may have trouble finding a new doctor to take you on or may get a worse doctor.I was forced to change doctors with my first at 30 weeks due to moving out of state and the doctor treated me like I was nothing....didn't need to get to know me because I was on with her for the last 10 weeks!Now as far as what you in your post.....baby's weight....i only new the weight when I had an ultrasound...other then that the doctor would always tell me if I was measuring on point (each appointment they measured my belly!If baby being head down yet....depending on how far you are....they usually don't worry about baby being head down until about 36 weeks....Once you start going for your weekly appointments the doctor will feel (they will do a belly exam and can feel if baby is head down) for position. ...and then do your internal exam (which will tell them your dialation, thinning, and also baby position)!Also don't be afraid to ask or discuss your concerns....sometimes doctors get I to a routine with patients and then they forget you are a first time mom!Best of luck hun!
My last ultrasound was January 5, and I was 25 weeks. My baby girl weighed 1 pound 11 ounces. My doctor said that unless something goes wrong there is no need for another ultrasound.

That seems normal. My last ultrasound was at 22 weeks which was my gender one. I wasn't even told the weight then. Just that my baby was a healthy baby boy. I asked my doctor if I would have another ultrasound and she said unless they think something is wrong they usually don't do another. And when I was 34 weeks I had guessed my baby had turned head down due to more activity in my ribs and she checked by pressing on my tummy. I had a student in the room so She even explained what to feel for and how to tell which way he was facing. I don't think based on those reasons you would need to change doctors. Especially so late in the game. Just ands and set your next appointment.

Ultrasounds are done as little as possible because it is not very good for the baby to have too many ultrasounds. I have to have one done every month because my placenta is sitting too low, but they try to make it aa quick as possible. The doctor can feel with his or her hands if your baby is in the right position. Its a good sign if you don't need multiple ultrasounds.

My Dr won't do another ultrasound unless he thinks something is wrong. I believe this to be pretty common as i have asked all my friends (including pediatric nurse friends) & they tell me the same thing. Ultrasounds can be pretty rough on the baby so they try to do as few as possible.

I had my gender/anatomy scan at 18 weeks and that was supposed to be my last but they found placenta previa so I have another check on Friday (21 weeks) to see if it moved. With my last one I only had extra ultrasounds when I had preeclampsia at 8 months. I know its frustrating to not see your baby more but your Dr has delivered many babies and usually they know what they're doing. I know its impossible but try to relax and have faith. Being a ftm is hard and scary but the schedule the Dr has for you is common as far as I can tell. As nice as it is to see my baby again I wish I didn't have to because it means everything isn't perfect. Does that make sense?

I'm 32w today and my doc measure my belly twice and the 2md time i had to ask cause my belly ain't huge but then she said my baby was good and growing right...and that was at my 30w,2d appt...i go to the doc every 2 weeks and i go back April 3..then i be 33w,2d and i just try and make a doc appt somewhere else they said they might not be able to see me since I'm so far along and I'm due May 20...ugh i guess its me and i should just weigh it out because i don't have that long!!!!

question: Need advice FTM: okay my last ultra sound was when I find out what i was having 12/30/13 and that's the last time they told me my baby weight...and i don't know if my baby girl heads down nor do i know her weight...so should i change docs cause my insurance already told me thru paying for everything but my doc office say other...my question ours should i change doctors!!!! Something isn't normal
